A.description: Dump all tables in all databases

c.description: Use complete INSERT statements that include column names

C.description: Compress all information sent between client and server

B.description: Interpret all name arguments as database names

K.description: For each table, surround INSERT statements with statements to disable and enable keys

F.description: Flush MySQL server log files before starting dump

f.description: Continue even if an SQL error occurs during a table dump

h.description: Host on which MySQL server is located

x.description: Lock all tables across all databases

l.description: Lock all tables before dumping them

M.description: Increase network timeouts to permit larger table dumps

n.description: Do not write CREATE DATABASE statements

t.description: Do not write CREATE TABLE statements that re-create each dumped table

y.description: Do not write any CREATE LOGFILE GROUP or CREATE TABLESPACE statements in output

p.description: Password to use when connecting to server

W.description: Connect to server using named pipe (Windows only)

q.description: Retrieve rows for a table from the server a row at a time

r.description: Direct output to a given file

R.description: Dump stored routines (procedures and functions) from dumped databases

S.description: Unix socket file or Windows named pipe to use

u.description: MySQL user name to use when connecting to server

w.description: Dump only rows selected by given WHERE condition

add-drop-database.description: Add DROP DATABASE statement before each CREATE DATABASE statement

add-drop-table.description: Add DROP TABLE statement before each CREATE TABLE statement

add-drop-trigger.description: Add DROP TRIGGER statement before each CREATE TRIGGER statement

add-locks.description: Surround each table dump with LOCK TABLES and UNLOCK TABLES statements

all-databases.description: Dump all tables in all databases

allow-keywords.description: Allow creation of column names that are keywords

apply-replica-statements.description: Include STOP REPLICA prior to CHANGE REPLICATION SOURCE TO statement and START REPLICA at end of output

apply-slave-statements.description: Include STOP SLAVE prior to CHANGE MASTER statement and START SLAVE at end of output

bind-address.description: Use specified network interface to connect to MySQL Server

character-sets-dir.description: Directory where character sets are installed

column-statistics.description: Write ANALYZE TABLE statements to generate statistics histograms

compatible.description: Produce output that is more compatible with other database systems or with older MySQL servers

complete-insert.description: Use complete INSERT statements that include column names

compress.description: Compress all information sent between client and server

compression-algorithms.description: Permitted compression algorithms for connections to server

create-options.description: Include all MySQL-specific table options in CREATE TABLE statements

databases.description: Interpret all name arguments as database names

debug-check.description: Print debugging information when program exits

debug-info.description: Print debugging information, memory, and CPU statistics when program exits

defaults-extra-file.description: Read named option file in addition to usual option files

delete-master-logs.description: On a replication source server, delete the binary logs after performing the dump operation

delete-source-logs.description: On a replication source server, delete the binary logs after performing the dump operation

disable-keys.description: For each table, surround INSERT statements with statements to disable and enable keys

dump-date.description: Include dump date as "Dump completed on" comment if --comments is given

dump-replica.description: Include CHANGE REPLICATION SOURCE TO statement that lists binary log coordinates of replica's source

dump-slave.description: Include CHANGE MASTER statement that lists binary log coordinates of replica's source

fields-enclosed-by.description: This option is used with the --tab option and has the same meaning as the corresponding clause for LOAD DATA

fields-escaped-by.description: This option is used with the --tab option and has the same meaning as the corresponding clause for LOAD DATA

fields-optionally-enclosed-by.description: This option is used with the --tab option and has the same meaning as the corresponding clause for LOAD DATA

fields-terminated-by.description: This option is used with the --tab option and has the same meaning as the corresponding clause for LOAD DATA

flush-logs.description: Flush MySQL server log files before starting dump

flush-privileges.description: Emit a FLUSH PRIVILEGES statement after dumping mysql database

force.description: Continue even if an SQL error occurs during a table dump

get-server-public-key.description: Request RSA public key from server

hex-blob.description: Dump binary columns using hexadecimal notation

host.description: Host on which MySQL server is located

include-master-host-port.description: Include MASTER_HOST/MASTER_PORT options in CHANGE MASTER statement produced with --dump-slave

include-source-host-port.description: Include SOURCE_HOST and SOURCE_PORT options in CHANGE REPLICATION SOURCE TO statement produced with --dump-replica

insert-ignore.description: Write INSERT IGNORE rather than INSERT statements

lines-terminated-by.description: This option is used with the --tab option and has the same meaning as the corresponding clause for LOAD DATA

lock-all-tables.description: Lock all tables across all databases

lock-tables.description: Lock all tables before dumping them

log-error.description: Append warnings and errors to named file

master-data.description: Write the binary log file name and position to the output

max-allowed-packet.description: Maximum packet length to send to or receive from server

net-buffer-length.description: Buffer size for TCP/IP and socket communication

network-timeout.description: Increase network timeouts to permit larger table dumps

no-autocommit.description: Enclose the INSERT statements for each dumped table within SET autocommit = 0 and COMMIT statements

no-create-db.description: Do not write CREATE DATABASE statements

no-create-info.description: Do not write CREATE TABLE statements that re-create each dumped table

no-tablespaces.description: Do not write any CREATE LOGFILE GROUP or CREATE TABLESPACE statements in output

order-by-primary.description: Dump each table's rows sorted by its primary key, or by its first unique index

password.description: Password to use when connecting to server

pipe.description: Connect to server using named pipe (Windows only)

quick.description: Retrieve rows for a table from the server a row at a time

replace.description: Write REPLACE statements rather than INSERT statements

result-file.description: Direct output to a given file

routines.description: Dump stored routines (procedures and functions) from dumped databases

server-public-key-path.description: Path name to file containing RSA public key

set-charset.description: Add SET NAMES default_character_set to output

set-gtid-purged.description: Whether to add SET @@GLOBAL.GTID_PURGED to output

shared-memory-base-name.description: Shared-memory name for shared-memory connections (Windows only)

show-create-skip-secondary-engine.description: Exclude SECONDARY ENGINE clause from CREATE TABLE statements

single-transaction.description: Issue a BEGIN SQL statement before dumping data from server

skip-add-drop-table.description: Do not add a DROP TABLE statement before each CREATE TABLE statement

skip-comments.description: Do not add comments to dump file

skip-compact.description: Do not produce more compact output

skip-quick.description: Do not retrieve rows for a table from the server a row at a time

skip-set-charset.description: Do not write SET NAMES statement

socket.description: Unix socket file or Windows named pipe to use

source-data.description: Write the binary log file name and position to the output

ssl-ca.description: File that contains list of trusted SSL Certificate Authorities

ssl-capath.description: Directory that contains trusted SSL Certificate Authority certificate files

ssl-crl.description: File that contains certificate revocation lists

ssl-crlpath.description: Directory that contains certificate revocation-list files

ssl-fips-mode.description: Whether to enable FIPS mode on client side

ssl-mode.description: Desired security state of connection to server

tls-ciphersuites.description: Permissible TLSv1.3 ciphersuites for encrypted connections

tls-version.description: Permissible TLS protocols for encrypted connections

triggers.description: Dump triggers for each dumped table

tz-utc.description: Add SET TIME_ZONE='+00:00' to dump file

user.description: MySQL user name to use when connecting to server

where.description: Dump only rows selected by given WHERE condition

zstd-compression-level.description: Compression level for connections to server that use zstd compression
